anſwered ſonne ſet father becauſe ſeems ſpake name father old therefore may well ſo able return anſwer cannot ſpeak unto thee bad good cannot ſpeak thing againſt ſpeaks good againſt thing propounded ſome poſterity little reviving dignitie judah tribe yet within year ſupreme yea regall power came hand macchabees tribe levi yet ruled many king jew untill herod wholly take away principality objection ſome anſwer though time macchabees indeed tribe levi chief power removed tribe judah yet lawgiver foot wit sanhedrin great councell ſeventy elder cognizance weightieſt cauſes appertained eſtabliſhing law ſtill elected tribe judah continued conſtantly exerciſe power untill little birth chriſt herod mere ſtranger became king judea rooted quite yet becauſe chief thing alledged anſwer ſatisfie objection wit sanhedrin choſen tribe judah taken granted cannot well proved full anſwer conceive given others theſe following particular 1 judah meant whole nation kingdome jew ten tribe ſtill government may ſaid judah yea therefore may well thought main thing intended prophecie whereas thoſe kingdome ten tribe iſrael carried away captive aſſyria never return thence become kingdome make known ſhall ſay unto pharaoh verſ 18 moſes went returned jethr • father law ſaid unto let go c moſes ask father law leave go egypt queſtioning whether ſhould obey god command going unleſſe would give leave onely judging fit ſhould acquaint father law purpoſe crave approbation go rudely away daughter child without giving notice beforehand eſpe • ially conſidering cauſe ſuſpect either wiſdome courteſie father giving liberty moſes therefore herein blamed rather modeſty humilitie herein diſcovered worthy admiration ſo glorious viſion way puffed carried himſelf ſuch humble lowly manner towards father law alledging reaſon jethro returning egypt onely deſire viſit ſee brother let go pray thee return unto brother egypt ſee whether yet alive therein alſo modeſty diſcovered could forbear tell father law glorious viſion ſeen honourable imployment god put upon likewiſe wiſdome managing buſineſſe doubteleſſe purpoſely conceal hewas ſent fetch iſraelites egypt becauſe judged fit impart ſecret jethro ſtock iſrael though godly man acquainted iſraelites themſelves likewiſe eſpecially leſt difficultie danger work ſhould make father law unwilling let go verſ 19 lord ſaid unto moſes midian c wit either asked father leave appearing god moſes horeb midian whether appearing moſes midian asked leave go cannot certainly conclude either moſes even leave obtained jethro yet haſtened journey fitting therefore ſecond apparition god quickned elſe took firſt viſion burning buſh god onely called work going egypt deliverance iſraelites expreſſely told time ſhould go ſo waited till ſecond viſion land midian god appeared commanded immediately go thither adding encouragement ſaid men dead ſought life doubtleſſe time ſojourning father law midian thought god formerly revealed egypt concerning lord imploying ſervice onely waited ſee god would call thereto happely might reaſon ſo many year ſend know condition brother egypt becauſe reſolved wholly caſt himſelf herein upon kingdome priest holy nation nation god hath ſpeciall priviledge ſeparated others conſecrated himſelf verſ 9 lo come unto thee thick cloud hand meet thee upon mount sinai thick cloud meant cloud went iſraelites ſhevv vvay travail vvilderneſſe vvhich god uſually ſpeak moſes vvhen reſted upon tabernacle cloud mentioned aftervvard verſ 16 vvherein god ſpake • moſes upon mount came paſſe third day morning thunder lightning thick cl • ud upon mount verſ 10 let waſh clothes hereby vvas ſignified hovv carefull god people ſhould clenſe themſelves filthineſſe fleſh ſpirit eſpecially vvhen come god preſence verſ 11 ready againſt third day c vvas fifty dayes paſſeover vvhich time feaſt aftervvard kept uſually called pentecoſt day vvhereon fiery lavv vvas given day vvhereon fiery tongue vvere aftervvards given preaching goſpel therefore vvas third day moneth could fiftieth day paſſeover lavv vvas given ſome dayes coming sina • firſt day moneth verſ 1 ſpent hath hitherto related concerning moſes going betwixt god people third day god gave moſes charge concerning preparing ſanctifying people verſ 12 thou ſhalt ſet bound unto people round c commanded firſt ſtrike heart greater reverence liberty matth 5 39 saviour repeated law addeth ſay unto ye reſist evil whereby never intended aboliſh law onely clear falſe expoſition jew thence took unto themſelves liberty private revenge chriſt condemnes rather enjoyns diſcipiles bear patiently wrong done judge revengers cauſe verſ 26 ſhall let go free eye ſake ſo alſo loſſe member chiefeſt eye meaneſt tooth onely expreſſed verſ 28 ox gore man woman die ox ſhall ſurely ſtoned c one kind beaſt moſt uſuall amongſt hebrew put verſ 31 whether gored ſonne gored daughter c ſame puniſhment allotted former verſes puniſhment whoſe ox killed man woman grown year alſo allotted though onely man child whether ſonne daughter killed ſuch ox verſ 32 ox ſhall puſh manſervant maidſervant ſhall give unto master thirty ſhek • l price chriſt valued became ſervant ſakes appointed paid liew ſervant killed verſ 33 man ſhall open pit c conceive muſt onely▪ meant pit mad • open publick wayes thoſe men digged private ground whereas puniſhment appointed caſe child man woman dark ſhould fall ſuch pit probable left judge determined proportionably determined former law verſ 28 29 30 chap xxii verſ 1 man ſhall ſteal ox ſheep kill ſell c underſtanding law muſt know firſt ſaid concerning ſtealing ox ſheep muſt alſo rule proportion underſtood concerning cattel ox ſheep onely mentioned becauſe chief therefore verſ 4 aſſe alſo mentioned ſecondly upon thief ſtole cattel greater fine ſet upon ſtole thing thoſe ſtole thing onely allotted pay double verſ 7 thoſe ſtole cattel reſtore fourefold fivefold reaſon becauſe men cattel left abroad moſt danger therefore ſuch theft reſtrained greater ſeverity thirdly reaſon fourefold fivefold reſtitution enjoyned caſe cattel ſtollen killed fold whereas found hand ſtole onely reſtore double verſ 4 becauſe cattel ſtill might ſeem ſome remorſe ſimplicity killed ſold ſeemed cunning boldneſſe beſides owner put greater charge trouble finding therefore penalty greater fourthly thief reſtore five ox ox foure ſheep ſheep becauſe loſſe ox greater loſſe beſides owner loſt labour ox therefore theft reſtrained ſomewhat greater ſeverity verſ 4 ſhall restore double caſe hath made away ox ſheep c ſhall reſtore ſtollen another good full value indeed double reſtitution ordinary penalty theft unleſſe caſe mentioned ſtole cattel afterwards killed ſold ſo expreſſely ſaid concerning thoſe ſtole hired ſhall make good verſ 16 man entice maid betrothed lie c maid betrothed death lie deut 22 23 24 damſel virgin betrothed unto husband man find city lie ye ſhall ſtone ſtones die law concerning defiling maid betrothed caſe provided man entice maid either promiſe marriage otherwiſe lie endow marry caſe father refuſed let marrie pay ſumme money according dowry virgin according eſtate condition dowry uſed given maid like parentage eſtate another law much like deut 22 28 29 wit man find damſel virgin betrothed lay hold lie found marry might never aſterwards put away withall pay unto maid father fifty ſhekels ſilver ſhew diſference betwixt theſe two law ſome ſay meant ſuch enticing maid perſwade conſent ſo lie law deuteronomie meant ſuch defile maid without conſent therefore greater penalty allotted thoſe theſe conſent maid defiled becauſe moſt probable violent rape maid way conſented alwayes amongſt people puniſhed death therefore cannot think law deuteronomie meant thoſe raviſhed maid rather difference betwixt theſe law conſiſts place deuteronomie law ſpeaks defiling maids▪ occaſionally laid hold yielded preſently luſt defiled beforehand allured perſwaded degree ſinne receive ſuch report ſo carry ſpread abroad amongſt others put thine hand wicked unrighteous witneſſe afford thine help aid thoſe combine themſelves together accuſe man falſely magiſtrate lends whereby men defrauded right either buying ſelling otherwiſe verſ 12 ye ſhall ſwear name falſely next law againſt falſe dealing defrauding inſerted becauſe perj • ry men uſe help forward falſe dealing nether ſhalt thou profane name thy god wit nether perjury vain ſwearing verſ 14 thou ſhalt • urſe deaf c theſe particular curſing deaf laying stumblingblock blind alſo forbidden injury done men confidence party injured ſhall able know wronged ſo power defend right themſelves yea even putting ſtumblingblocks conſciences men becauſe lord plead cauſe thoſe thus wronged implyed laſt word ſhalt fear lord thy god ſaid let fear god theſe caſes reſtrain thee though deaf blind need feared verſ 16 neither ſhalt thou ſtand againſt bloud thy neighbour though thing againſt life neighbour forbidden yet evil principally forbidden ſtanding court juſtice take away man life either falſe accuſer falſe witneſſe rather ſubjoyned foregoing law thou ſhalt go taleb • arer among thy people becauſe talebearing doth uſually tend doegs example may ſee derprive men life according prophet ezek 22 9 thee men carry tale ſhed bloud verſ 17 thou ſhalt hate thy brother thy heart thou ſhalt wiſe rebuke c man hath wronged thing ſhall go away cloſely nouriſh hatred heart againſt ſecretly carry tale others mean ſeaſon never open mouth wrong quite contrary ſhall brotherly manner rebuke evil done ſo may reclaim thoſe evil wayes conceive drift precept yet withall may imply doth rebuke brother ſees amiſſe doth indeed hate love becauſe ſuffers runne ſinne ſeeks amendment verſ 18 thou ſhalt love thy brother thy ſelf clauſe thy ſelf doth denote exact perfect equality love certain proportion likeneſſe doth bind men love neighbour ſame degree love 1 ſhould deſire ſeek hurt neighbour themſelves 2 ſhould endeavour good neighbour themſelves 3 ſhould love neighbour ſame manner heartily ſincerely conſtantly love themſelves expreſſion therefore unlike joh 17 21 saviour prayed true believer might one father thou father art thee doth impart ſame union onely likeneſſe union verſ 19 ye ſhall keep ſtatutes repeated prefixed ſhew ordinance following muſt neglected though ſeeming ſlight becauſe even foure thouſand • ix hundred able men outward wa • fare hoſt iſrael numb 1 27 levite eight thouſand five hundred fourſcore men fit ſervice chap v verſ 2 command child iſrael put camp every leper c wit ver 41 balak took balaam brought high place baal thence might ſee utmoſt part people amongſt ground conceit one might beholding iſraelites ſpeech might vehemency ſpirit better effect ſuppoſed indeed lodge night bring word lord ſhall ſpeak unto evident balaam ſorcerer noted joſh 13 22 likewiſe idolater ſee afterwards chap 23 12 offered ſacrifices upon baal high place doth ſpeak lord jehovah text bring word lord jehovah ſhall ſpeak unto anſwer firſt moſt probable ſome ſmall remainder knowledge true god ſtill left amongſt theſe idolatrous nation poſterity abraham lot yea make profeſſion worſhipping true god though withall worſhipped falſe god ſo conceive balaam therefore verſ 18 call god lord god ſo though idolater ſouthſayer yet might pretend himſelf prophet lord jehovah ſecondly amongſt thing part magick skill ſouthſayers former time inchantments ſeek ruine people uſed deal god defender people called • telary god clear profane writer romanes intended beſiege city prieſts wont firſt call god whoſe tutelage protection city promiſe ample place honour among thus ſome conceive balaam undertook enquire lord jehovah knew god hebrew ſee whether might taken defending firſt conceive diſallowed hereby meant either lord would forgive raſhneſſe vowing ſhe power rather lord would impute ſinne ſeeing father refuſed let keep verſ 8 husband diſallowed day heard c laſt clauſe day heard ſhe made free divorce indeed dependance theſe word upon went verſ 9 concerning widow wife divorced ſtrong argument expoſition verſ 13 every vow every binding oath afflict ſoul husband may establiſh onely affliction perſon abſtinence faſting c verſ 15 ſhall wayes make void hath heard ſhall bear iniquitie though wife hath full libe • ty perform vow husband heard day contradict yet afterward husband ſhall violently refuſe let perform however god law might caſe wife muſt ſtrive againſt husband ſhall bear iniquity is▪ ſinne ſhall imputed husband would kept promiſe ſhe might chap xxxi verſ 2 moſes conduct joſhua verſ 4 every tribe thouſand thro • ghout tribe iſrael ſhall ye ſend warre conſidering multitude enemie encounter may gathered rich prey death five king amongſt others ſlain verſ 8 withall man • hundred thouſand fighting men iſrael moſes might ſent forth would ſtrange courſe moſes head onely ſend forth twelve thouſand againſt ſuch mighty enemy therefore make queſtion moſes received particular dire • tions god though expreſſed ſhould ſend twelve thouſand▪ thereby try faith iſraelites make god hand victory evident ſhould equally c • lled every tribe one tribe might exalt moſeroth moſes encamped went back towards red ſea eaſt part thereof called mount hor returned northward towards land canaan ſo though aaron dyed mount hor yet ſaid moſera aaron dyed buried becauſe moſera mount hor one ſame mountain third greateſt difficultie ſeeming contradiction betwixt place numb 33 31 ſaid iſraelites went benejaakan beeroth child jaakan moſera ſo gudgodah jotbath▪ yet quite contrary one particular ſaid went moſera moſeroth benejaakan ſo thence gudgodah horhagidgad called thence jotbathah jotbath written anſwer ſome expoſitours ſay place named ſame mentioned num 33 31 32 33 becauſe foure place named together mentioned alſo together ſo little variation name moſera moſeroth gudgodah horhagidgad jotbath jotbathah benejaakan beeroth well child jaakan hard think moſes theſe two place ſpeaks ſame journey iſraelites another expoſitour therefore bonfrerius • jeſuite anſwers difficultie thus went back kadeſhbarnea red ſea iſraelites went indeed moſeroth part mountain called alſo mount hor benejaakan ſaid numb 33 31 returned red ſea towards land canaan way farre diſtant gon came firſt beeroth child jaakan benejaakan ſo thence went moſeroth moſera indeed anſwer would ſatisfactory one objection made againſt ſeems unanſwerable deut 33 ſaid gone paſt moſeroth benejaakan went firſt gudgodah horhagidgad thence jotbath jotbathah cannot moſes▪ſpeaks iſraelites becauſe would like nation onely foretelling would thereupon preſcribing certain law prevent greater miſchiefs erecting monarchy amongſt verſ 15 thou ſhalt wiſe ſet king thee lord thy god ſhall chooſe c lord give two rule ſhould bound ever ſhould deſire king reigne firſt ſhould onely make ſuch one king god ſhould chooſe accordingly obſerved partly saul fully david progeny god ordaining poſterity ſhould ſucceſſively inherit kingdome thus appointed becauſe king judah type chriſt choſen god great king iſrael pſal 2 6 ſet king upon holy hill sion ſecond might onely chooſe one amongſt brother king firſt becauſe ſuch one likelieſt love beloved rule equity gentleneſſe ſecondly leſt ſtranger another nation ſhould bring ſtrange law cuſtomes yea corrupt religion thirdly ſignifie promiſed meſſiah lord anointed ſeed abraham according fleſh even one nation verſ 16 ſhall multiply horſes himſelf c exceſſively even beyond reaſonably ſtate king may require lord give charge concerning king iſrael firſt teach king people put ſole truſt confidence god rely outward ſtrength horſes chariot men abundance ſuch military force prone ſecondly might hereby exalted puffed mind even deſpiſing perhaps oppreſſing brother thirdly might maintain exceſſive charge hereof burdenſome ſubjects herein therefore may well think solomon keep ſo cloſe rule god word ought done fourty thouſand ſtalls horſes chariot twelve thouſand horſemen 1 king 4 26 likewiſe fetcht horſes egypt 2 chron 1 16 expreſſely alſo forbidden ſhall multiply horſes himſelf cauſe people return egypt end ſhould multiply horſes onely becauſe egypt neighbouring countreys moſt famous horſes whence eſa 31 3 egyptian men god horſes fleſh ſpirit ſo imply one reaſon lord forbad ſo many horſes leſt ſhould go egypt procure themſelves horſes much lord hath ſaid unto ye ſhall henceforth return way ye ſhall return egypt returning egypt ſame way came thence forbidden generally going back egypt yea though w • nt thither dwell ſojourn onely trade merchandiſe ſo much place ſeems imply reaſon law ſeems firſt hereby might kept corrupted idolatry foul ſinnes making wicked leag • e confed • racy ſecondly hereby might ta • ght ſuch thankfulneſſe rem • mber former del • verance bondage endured land abhorre thought going thither leſt ſhould ſeem contempt former eſcape thence unthankfull forgetting gloriou • deliverance ngling diver ſeeds might prevented mingling fruit ſe • fruit vine therefore conceive ſowing ſeed together vine ſorbidden indeed becauſe rea • given law fruit ſeed ſowen fruit vine might mingled together ſo defiled worth conſidering whether meant rather ſeed fruittrees corn herb fruit whereof likely mingled vine thus law levit 19 19 ſowing ſeverall kind grain one field forbidden ſo ſowing ſeed fruittrees together vine reaſon annexed law lest fruit thy ſeed thou haſt ſown fruit thy vineyard defiled ſome underſtand thus leſt fruit ſeed vineyard corrupred marred wit becauſe whileſt heart maſters flying verſ 17 ſhall wh • daughter iſrael sodomite c though tolerating whore sodomite ſonnes daughter iſrael onely expreſſed yet neceſſary conſequence permitting ſuch open filthineſſe nation ſhould live amongſt alſo forbidden beſides enſnaring god people commit filthineſſe might alſo corrupt regard religion ſeduce degree open idolatrie verſ 18 thou ſhalt bring hire whore price dog houſe lord c great queſtion amongſt expoſitours meant price dog firſt ſome conceive becauſe theſe two joyned thus together hire whore price dog laſt intended ſome filthy thing well firſt ſo conclude amongſt u men wont ſometimes give money ſome goodly horſe cover mare ſo thoſe time dog meant price dog secondly others think meant ſuch men openly ſight others commit uncleanneſſe moſt impudent brutiſh manner thirdly others think foregoing verſe whore sodomite joyned together ſhall whore daughter iſrael sodomite ſonnes iſrael ſo likewiſe dog meant sodomite word dog uſed metaphorically alſo rev 22 15 without dog price dog meant hire given men commit horrid unnaturall ſinne sodomie laſt moſt expoſitours take according plain meaning word price dog ſold unclean withall baſe contemptible creature god would allow bring price houſe theſe two laſt expoſitions conceive moſt likely intended eſpecially laſt hereby god taught reverence ſanctuary ſacrifices lev 19 30 offer thing ſinfully gotten contribute eaſie yet inſerted moſes drift herein eaſily diſcerned ſay unfitly ſubjoyned foregoing exhortation obſerving carefully law god becauſe diſcovers ſo give u hint take heed ordinary root diſobedience wit men ambitious know buſily ſearch god ſecret counſels nothing mean taken minding thoſe revealed duty ſo nearly concern rather conceive clauſe inſerted either way explaining formerly delivered wit ſaid onely thus provoke lord ruine ſhould certainly befall god revealed god revealed became child ſeriouſly lay heart elſe way preventing objection againſt threatned ſhould object god infinitely mercifull would therefore deſtroy people • wers secret thing belong unto lord farre ſhew mercy either forbearing giving grace repent depends onely upon ſecret counſel cannot ſearch thoſe thing revealed belong unto u child ever revealed rebell againſt poure theſe judgement upon land except repentance turning prevent ruine therefore muſt look to▪ ſo avoiding ſinne may prevent judgement moſt probably full
